intro: Tephrosia transjubensis, commonly known as the Transjubense Tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to the semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are trifoliate, with small, oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences. The plant is adapted to dry conditions and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and forage for various animals.
